intro: Dasistepha, commonly known as the African eggplant or wild eggplant, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant produces small, round, egg-shaped fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red or purple when mature. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while the stems are woody and branched. Dasistepha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit appearance.
